item.title: Amazon VPC CNI x Cilium
item.description: In this hybrid mode, the Amazon VPC CNI is responsible for setting up the virtual network devices as well as for IP address management (IPAM) via ENIs.

item.title: AWS VPC
item.description: With Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), you can launch AWS resources in a logically isolated virtual network that you’ve defined.

item.title: Data Contract
item.description: Definition It’s an API-like formal agreement between the Data Product and the data product consumer. It specifies the guarantees about a provided data set and expectations concerning Data Product usage.

item.title: eBPF
item.description: A Linux kernel bytecode interpreter originally introduced to filter network packets, e.g. tcpdump and socket filters. It has since been extended with additional data structures such as hashtable and arrays as well as additional actions to support packet mangling, forwarding, encapsulation, etc

item.title: Elastic Network interfaces
item.description: AnÂ elastic network interfaceÂ is a logical networking component in a VPC that represents a virtual network card. It can include the following attributes:

item.title: How to access private repositories from Github Actions?
item.description: When running in Github Actions, the private repositories can not be accessed since the runners is not configured to access the private repositories.

item.title: Security group
item.description: A security group acts as a firewall that controls the traffic allowed to and from the resources in your virtual private cloud (VPC).

item.title: Semantic model
item.description: Machine and human-readable model definition that captures the domain model of the data: How the data product models the domain, what types of entities the data includes, the properties of the entities, the relationships between the entities, etc.

item.title: Service-level objectives
item.description: Data quality metrics [!important] Accuracy The degree of how closely the data represents the true value of the attribute in the real-world context

item.title: Syntax model
item.description: Data Product encodes its semantic according to the access models supported by its output ports. This the syntax model. Every output port will model have its own syntax model.
